old use or literary Christmas: The millennium's first Yule was memorable for several reasons. On this trip you will catch the Yule vibe at Germany's loveliest Christmas market. Synonyms
Christmas
NoelSee also
Xmas abbreviation
Yuletide old-fashioned or literary
in the past, a winter celebration held by Germanic peoples in the time before Christianity came to their countries: Yule is an old northern European winter festival. The tradition of bringing greenery into the house dates back to the pagan festival of Yule, when it was intended to ward off evil spirits.
in modern times, a winter celebration held by some pagans (= people who belong to a modern religion that includes beliefs and activities that are not from any of the main religions of the world, for example the worship of nature): Wiccans celebrate Yule around December 21, the winter solstice, because nights then start to become shorter.
More examplesFewer examplesAs another word for the festive period, Yule comes via Old English from jol , an ancient Scandinavian word for a series of winter festivities.They looked like City types on a country break for Yule. Let's celebrate the spirit of Yule!Next week they will attend the Pagan festival of Yule to celebrate the rebirth of the sun.
